title: 16-year-old New Zealander ran a 3:48 mile at BU’s Terrier Classic, set a junior world record
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Sam Ruthe, a 16-year-old from New Zealand, ran a mile in 3:48.88 at BU's Terrier Classic, breaking a junior world record.
Ruthe's time surpassed John Walker's 1982 New Zealand mile record of 3:49.08, making it the national record outright.
The current world record for the mile, however, remains at 3:43.13, set by Hicham El Guerrouj in 1999.

title: Livestream: Ms. G, Massachusetts’ official groundhog, to make annual prediction
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Ms. G, Massachusetts' official groundhog, will make her annual weather prediction at Drumlin Farm Wildlife Sanctuary.
The event takes place in Lincoln, Massachusetts, on February 2 at 10 a.m.
The prediction will indicate whether there will be an early spring or six more weeks of winter.

title: Massachusetts keeps losing residents to other states, Census finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Massachusetts experienced a net outflow of over 30,000 residents, moving primarily to Florida, New Hampshire, and New York.
Challenges include high taxes, housing costs, and healthcare expenses, with retirees being a major group leaving Massachusetts.
Despite losing residents domestically, Massachusetts had slight population growth due to international immigration, though at slower rates.

title: Photos: Day 2 at Something in the Way fest at Roadrunner
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Day 2 of the Something in the Way festival featured performances from 12 bands at Roadrunner in Brighton.
Sunny Day Real Estate headlined the event, closing out the day with their alt rock set.
Photographer Ben Stas captured performances from bands like Glixen, Wicca Phase Springs Eternal, and Sheer Mag.

title: For Bourne, the new Sagamore Bridge takings echo a long past
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The state plans to acquire 13 homes in Bourne for the new Sagamore Bridge project, impacting a tight-knit neighborhood.
Property acquisition in Bourne for infrastructure echoes historic land takings like the Cape Cod Canal's construction in the early 1900s.
Residents affected by eminent domain express concerns over displacement and fair compensation, with some families appealing the state's offers.

title: ‘It’s a joke’: David Pastrnak, Bruins vent after controversial OT call in Stadium Series
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Pastrnak's overtime goal against Tampa Bay was disallowed due to a controversial slashing penalty.
The Boston Bruins lost 6-5 to Tampa Bay in a shootout after giving up a 5-1 lead.
The Bruins criticized officials for game-deciding calls and receiving no penalties against Tampa.

title: 11 takeaways from Bruins’ wild shootout loss to Lightning in Stadium Series
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins lost 6-5 to Tampa Bay Lightning in a shootout during Sunday's Stadium Series at Raymond James Stadium.
The game featured a four-goal comeback by Tampa, officiating controversies, and a rare goalie fight between Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy.
Despite leading 5-1, the Bruins were hindered by penalties in the second period, allowing three power-play goals to Tampa Bay.

title: Former dairy farm in Dartmouth converted to $2M luxury home
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: The former Gulf Hill Dairy Farm barn in Dartmouth transformed into a 7,891-square-foot luxury home listed for $1,995,000.
The property features four bedrooms, six bathrooms, exposed beams, and a massive stone fireplace in an open floor plan.
Renovation completed in 2017 included eco-friendly updates like solar panels and a smart home system with radiant heat.

title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac, a Boston police veteran, died of cancer after over 30 years of service, BPD announced.
MacIsaac joined BPD in 1995, serving in West Roxbury and previously in Districts B-2, A-7, B-3, and C-6.
He was recognized for heroism in the Boston Marathon bombings and life-saving actions during his career.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman fought Lightning's Andrei Vasilevskiy during the Stadium Series game in Tampa.
Swayman and Vasilevskiy received penalties for fighting and leaving the crease after a second-period altercation.
The Bruins lost 6-5 in a shootout despite Swayman's 41 saves and post-game handshake with Vasilevskiy.
